Rap singer announces new arrivals to his animal ranch family

Bear, an award-winning musician and local resident, announced yesterday that he has added over 500 new animals to his exotic animal sanctuary, Shraavana, since April.

I'm like, you know, a new Daddy five hundred times over! Bear beamed. I should be giving out cigars!

Bear told this reporter that he was lucky to find some of the species in breeding pairs.

It's hard to find some of these little guys. For example, the Green Dragonbird is really, really rare!

The Green Dragonbird is much like a blue peacock, but the tail sports an iridescent greenish hue. Other species added to his collection include New Guinea Singing Dogs, Amur Tigers, Somali Ostriches, Short-tailed Chinchillas, and two Northeast Congo lions.

I've got an in with a local goat farmer, Bear told us, I don't want Pookey, that's the male lion, eating any of my Cuvier's Gazelle.

Bear plans to have a week-long open house once the animals are settled.
